basic.description: Since 2005 , an attempt has been made to fundamentally refurm UN institutions for global management of the use of force.  This on-going exercise has been largely unsuccessful.  This course will build on proposals to advance this process.  The seminar will address six clusters of issues which are key in the reform of the global drive to stability and the rule of law: (1) war between States; (2) violence within States, including civil wars, large scale human rights abuses and genocide; (3) poverty, infectious disease and environmental degradation; (4) nuclear, radiological, chemical and biological weapons; (5) terrorism; and (6) transnational crime.  The Seminar will consist of a series of introductory sessions, followed by student presentations and papers on key topics (War on terror, Iraq, Afghanistan, Darfur, Lebanon and Gaza Wars.  The Middle East Eruption, UN institutional reform, role of law and tribunals etc.)
